info.title: Frisbii REST API
info.description:
This document describes the endpoints of the Frisbii REST API. You can find out more about Frisbii here.

Swagger interactive usage / authentication:
This documentation offers interactive features which will enable you to test how our system behaves. To use the interactive features you have to aquire a bearer token for your active Frisbii sandbox account. This procedure is described here. OAuth token URL for sandbox is https://sandbox.frisbii-transform.com/oauth/token/, for production https://app.frisbii.com/oauth/token/. Please be aware the URL does not include [...]/api/v1/[...]After aquiring the token you must go through the 'Authorize'-Form down below (green button). You're now able to use the interactive features.
Please be aware your sandbox account will be affected trying out the endpoints!

Updates to API
We are constantly improving our API. We are trying to avoid breaking changes as much as possible. However, sometimes we have to make breaking changes. We will inform about breaking changes directly if these endpoints are used by your integration and grant sufficient time to react to the upcoming change. We will also inform about breaking changes in our changelog. Please be aware that we will not inform explicitly about non-breaking changes. We will not inform about changes in the following cases:
  • Adding a new enum value to a published public API endpoint is not considered a breaking change.
  • Adding new fields in API endpoint (request and response) is not considered a breaking change.
Integrations need to be built in a robust way that can deal with these sorts of changes by handling responses and objects in a generic way and ignoring unexpected types, enum values, fields.



Endpoints marked with [FEATURE] is an feature discriminated endpoint. Make sure your account has this feature enabled or contact support.Return to https://docs.frisbii-transform.com/

delete.description:
As long as the usage hasn't been billed yet, you can simply DELETE it. Otherwise, the process becomes ill-defined,
            especially in light of free quota. You can deduct the overbilled amount in the following month or write a credit note manually.

get.description: Usage with contractId parameter is recommended.

parameters.description: Concatenate to URL to limit search to specific contract

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description: Searches changes with a occured date equal or younger than the specified date, optional

parameters.description: Cursor from where on the items are listed

parameters.name: includeContract
parameters.description: If true - includes contract with phases; false by default

parameters.name: includePauses
parameters.description: If All - includes all pauses in change list; If Changed - includes changed pauses in change list; None by default

parameters.name: includeDiscountSubscriptions

parameters.name: includePauses
parameters.description: If All - includes all pauses in change list; If Changed - includes changed pauses in change list; None by default

get.summary: Retrieves a single contract by Id

delete.description:
Terminated contracts can be deleted from the system. Billwerk will ensure that the conditions are met before closing.
If some conditions are not met at the time of the request, billwerk stores the request, and will attempt deleting the contract until possible.
To ensure compliance with accounting principles, billwerk will archive the data relevant to accounting.

</br> 
Note: For GDPR personal data deletion request, DELETE /customers/{id} is also available and will ensure all contracts are deleted.

Using this endpoint can lead to interruptions in the billing process.

get.summary: Retrieve a short-lived Self-Service access token
get.description:
The token can be used by your customers to change their account and payment information for the given contract.
Retrieve the token immediately before redirecting the customer.

parameters.name: tokenValidity
parameters.description: Token validity, limited up to 10080 minutes (or 7 days)

put.description:
**Usage Advisory:**
- This endpoint is limited in scope: it does not affect the start dates of component subscriptions, metered usages, or discounts.
- Effective only when there are no phase changes post-trial end.
- Given the evolving nature of our features, there may be additional, unforeseen limitations.
- It exclusively modifies the trial phase; exercise caution with complex contracts involving components and discounts.
            
Please use this endpoint judiciously to ensure it aligns with your specific contract structures and requirements.

requestBody.description: DTO with new trial end date

get.summary: Retrieves a cancellation preview for a contract
get.description:
Retrieves a cancellation preview for a contract for a regular cancellation, considering contract and notice periods of the booked PlanVariant.
Property EndDate describes the date at which the contract would be cancelled when doing a regular cancellation. Property NextPossibleCancellationDate describes the date until which the contract can be cancelled using a regular cancellation achieving the next possible end date of the contract while adhering to the contract and notice periods configured.

parameters.name: cancellationTime
parameters.description: Defines when the contract will be cancelled

post.summary: Retrieves a pause preview for a contract
Set an end date for this contract
Annul a specific contract
Initiate a refund for a specific contract
Change payment method for a contract
post.description:
You can select whether the customer pays "On Account" or whether no payment data is stored for this contract by choosing "Without Payment Data" (selectedPaymentMethod  : "None:None")
With the payment provider Payone, you also have the option of storing or changing the debit memo data for your customers.
If your customer wants to pay via Paypal, credit card or direct debit, you can make the self-service customer portal available to him, in which he can enter his payment data.
You can find an explanation of the customer portal [here](https://support.frisbii.com/hc/en-us/articles/115001966609-Wie-kann-ich-die-gehostete-Bestellseite-und-das-Kundenportal-verwenden-).

get.summary: Retrieve a single customer

delete.description:
Deletes the customer and all its personal data in accordance with GDPR and accounting principles.

</br>
If the customer had some contracts with ledger entry, billwerk will archive the invoices and other relevant data.
To ensure compliance with data protection laws, customer data will be anonymized before archiving.

</br>
After archiving, customer will not be accessible through UI or API.

[FEATURE] Checks if a external subscription is active and returns the subscription and contract Ids.
post.description:
This endpoint is used by the mobile apps to check if a subscription is active and to import it into Frisbii platform.
Please find list of possible providers on more information [here](https://docs.frisbii-transform.com/docs/restApi/iap/integration).
            
External subscription feature is only available for Frisbii customers with the "External Subscriptions" add-on.
Please contact our [support team](support@frisbii-transform.com) for more information.

post.summary: Creates a file download token for the given invoice.
post.description:
The file can subsequently be downloaded through the given URL.
Please note that that URL is not under /api/v1 and doesn't need an OAuth token, i.e. you can present these links to your users.
Consequently, the links have limited validity.

get.summary: Retrieves a single order by Id

delete.description:
Orders which have not yet been finalized through commit can be deleted to remove the associated personal data from the system.
Orders must be created more than 2 hours ago to ensure that customer is not trying to finalize it.

</br>
Note: Committed orders trigger the creation of a contract. Such orders will be stored as long as contract exists. To delete them, the contract should be deleted as well.

post.summary: Create a new plan/component subscription or up/downgrade order.
post.description: Please note, orders might have a limited lifetime. For simple signup/subscription implementation we recommend using SubscriptionJS rather than API, unless you have strong reasons. CustomerChange does NOT work on Signups. The JSON must resemble a CustomerDTO.

get.summary: Retrieve payment transactions for an order

post.summary: Previews a signup order with pricing information
post.description:
This endpoint works very similar to POST /Orders, by returning an order object, but does not actually create the order persistently.
You can pass the same data. It can be used to show pricing information of the cart.
Likewise a real order creation it takes into account passed customer data like VAT ID and country to determine the actual price and taxes.

AccountingExportFileReadDTO.description: Applying format for errors from external API regarding any payment request.

Country.description: The 2-letter ISO country code in capital letters, e.g. DE
The 2-letter ISO country code in capital letters, e.g. DE

ApiMessage.description: Represents a message returned by the API.

BearerMedium.description: Enumerates the available media for documents.

CancellationDate.description: Date when the contract has been cancelled

NextPossibleCancellationDate.description: Date to which you can end this contract

EndDate.description: Date when the Contract will end

PlanVariantId.description: The ID of the planvariant to subscribe to

EnableTrial.description: Determines if a trial period will be enabled

ComponentSubscriptions.description: An array of additional components to subscribe to. Please note that id must be billwerk' id of the component (i.e. you can't use your own id here) and that the component must not be a metered component.

DiscountSubscriptions.description: An array of additional discounts to subscribe to. Please note that id must be billwerk' id of the discounts (i.e. you can't use your own id here)

MeteredUsages.description: An array of additional metered usages to subscribe to. Please note that id must be billwerk' id of the metered usage (i.e. you can't use your own id here)

RatedItems.description: An array of additional rated items to use

EndComponentSubscriptions.description: An array of component subscriptions which will be ended

EndDiscountSubscriptions.description: An array of discount subscriptions which will be ended

CouponCode.description: The coupon code which will be used

ComponentId.description: The ID of the component to subscribe to

Quantity.description: Determines the quantity of subscriptions to this component

CustomFields.description: Contains description of the component subscription custom fields

Quantity.description: Optional - Quantity of the subscribed component

StartDate.description: Optional - Date where the component subscription will start. Leave empty to start immediately

BilledUntil.description: Optional - Date until when the component subscription has been billed. Leave empty to force immediate billing

EndDate.description: Optional - Date where the component subscription will end

Memo.description: Memo attached to the component subscription
